conclusion: Use Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction to calculate maximum EMF.
Faraday's law states induced EMF is equal to negative rate of change of magnetic flux through the coil.
Define variables: induced EMF (E), number of turns (N = 100), magnetic flux (Φ).
Magnetic flux Φ varies sinusoidally with time t as shown in Figure Z.
Write equation for Φ(t) as Φ(t) = Φ_max sin(ωt).
Define variables: Φ_max = 2.0 x 10^-2 Wb, ω is angular frequency.
Flux completes one full cycle in T = 6.28 x 10^-2 s from the graph.
Calculate angular frequency ω using ω = 2π/T.
Substitute T = 6.28 x 10^-2 s to find ω = 100 rad/s.
Calculate rate of change of flux using dΦ/dt = Φ_max ω cos(ωt).
Determine maximum value of dΦ/dt when cos(ωt) = 1.
Calculate maximum EMF using E_max = N (dΦ/dt)_max.
Substitute N = 100 and (dΦ/dt)_max = 2.0 Wb/s to find E_max = 200 V.
The maximum value of the electromotive force generated is 200 V.
